page.title: 04ALDENHAM CHURCH
page.content: The village of {Aldenham}is mentioned in the Domesday book and there was probably an earlier Saxon church on the site of the Parish Church of St John the Baptist. The tower and Lady Chapel are 12th Century and the nave 14th. The use of{Hertfordshire {Puddingstone}in the tower construction is an exceptional feature. The church is asymmetrical, with the nave not central to the altar; the north door is not directly under its arch and the capitals on some of the pillars are at different heights. The Church has a fine choir, mentioned in Kilminster's "The Good Church Guide". The 8 a.m. Holy Communion is celebrated every Sunday, except the first of the month. Sung Eucharist is at 10.15 every other Sunday and Matins on the other. Sung Evensong is at 6.30 p.m. every Sunday.
